name: Editor's Choice
overview: Create a Netflix-style featured content slider on the main page.
description:
Create a Netflix-style featured content slider on the main page.

https://github.com/lachlandcp/jellyfin-editors-choice-plugin

versions.changelog: Fix version mismatch
Compatible with Jellyfin 10.11.0.

Updates compatability with FileTransformation. Fixes bug where un-rated items don't show despite minimum rating filter set to zero. Fixes bug loading on some TVs, adds option to hide slider on TV mode.

Improves function of 'new mode'. TV shows with an end date within the selected time period will be included. Restores 'open in new tab' ability to slider. Replaces 1.3.1.0 release which also: Improves FileTransformation mode reliability, adds heading option, and adds more options to 'New' mode
Adds integration with the FileTransformation plugin for easier installation.
Adds options to exclude played items, and configure the height of the slider.
Stylistic corrections and compatability with ElegantFin.
Re-release of 1.1.0.1 to fix versioning. Removes image resizing as default to improve plugin performance.
Adds new 'recent releases' mode, localisation for 'Watch' button, option to change autoplay interval, and options to show description and rating or not.
Adds parental rating filtering.
Fixes issues on TV mode.
New and improved slider! Including autoplay, looping, and improved loading reliability
Compatability with Jellygin 10.10.6
Allows filtering by library, adds 'Collections' mode, speeds up load times, and improves config UI
Allows filtering by minimum community or critic rating! And fixes slider on Jellyfin Android app
This version greatly improves the mechanism to load the slider, so that it is faster and more reliable.

Now works with Jellyfin 10.10.x. Other changes in this version include: Users can now only see items from libraries that they have permission to access. The option to show a particular number of items applies to 'favourites' mode as well as random mode. Slider will not show IMDB ratings if unavailable. Scroller buttons adjusted to stand out more on light background.
Fix bug where only admins can load the editors choice slider.
Add new 'random' banner option
Fix hyperlinks occassionally not working
Fix loading process
Fix links on banner items
Update for Jellyfin 10.9 and fix package versions for 10.9.1 to 10.9.3
Fix issues with favourited seasons/episodes and exclude other unsupported favouritable items
Initial release

versions.changelog: ## New Features 增加了重复剧集检测小工具，用于替换字幕组、发布 V2 版时自动清理旧版本 ## What's Changed * fix: handle null and empty ChineseName correctly by @chu-shen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/232 * fix: Emby plugin support for macOS ARM and .NET 6 runtime by @nihs903222 in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/233 * fix: implement IHasSupportedExternalIdentifiers for Emby by @sjtuross in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/236 * 修复Subject的PersonInfos或Characters拉取失败导致整个Subject的元数据拉取失败的问题 by @HydrogensaysHDT in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/238 ## New Contributors * @nihs903222 made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/233 * @sjtuross made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/236 * @HydrogensaysHDT made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/238 **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.7.5...1.7.6

## What's Changed
* 支持人物搜索
* 为 Emby 添加 bangumi.ini 支持 by @luoboQAQ in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/224
* 优化 markdown 换行转换，对于不支持 markdown 显示的第三方播放器更友好
* 修复元数据中 `Bangumi ID` 显示为 `Bangumi 专辑 ID` 的问题
* 修复插件配置目录不存在导致的登录失败 #218
* 添加了插件 logo 图（改自 https://www.pixiv.net/artworks/4455303 ）

## New Contributors
* @luoboQAQ made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/224

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.7.4...1.7.5

修复 Jellyfin 10.11.0 中遇到的一些小问题

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.7.3...1.7.4

## 支持 Jellyfin 10.11

注：如需使用 10.10 及更早的版本，请到 Release 中下载老版本

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.7.2...1.7.3

注：这可能是最后一个支持 Jellyfin 10.10 的版本，目前看来 Jellyfin 10.11 API 有变化，待正式版发布后插件会及时适配

## What's Changed
* fix: More robust error message matching by @RandomNamer in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/195
* feat: add collection by subject's relation by @chu-shen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/160
* feat: add ui for controlling rating refresh intervals by @RandomNamer in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/203
* feat: try match following seasons by name when first season is not pr… by @RandomNamer in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/202
* Fix：部分文件季号刮削错误 by @wsgh0202 in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/208
* refactor: separate the basic parser by @chu-shen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/163
* refactor: extract local configuration handling to LocalConfigurationH… by @chu-shen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/210

## New Contributors
* @wsgh0202 made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/208

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.7.1...1.7.2

## What's Changed

- 优化离线数据库更新逻辑
- 近期放送的剧集始终使用在线 API 获取
- 增加 [公共标签](https://bgm.tv/group/topic/406595) 支持
- 修复 OAuth 授权时间显示不正确的问题（不影响正常使用）
- 修正查询图片时没有携带登录态的问题 #181
- 代码结构 / 打包流程调整 #159 

最新 CI 测试包可以在 https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/releases/tag/ci 下载

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.7.0...1.7.1

## Important
 - 支持 Jellyfin 10.10.0（向下兼容 10.9.0）
 - [离线数据库](https://github.com/bangumi/Archive/) 支持：
   - 当存在离线数据时库时，优先通过离线数据库查询
   - 默认每周更新一次，可在 Jellyfin - 计划任务 中自行修改
   - 离线数据库下载解压过程需要占用约 1GB 内存，索引过程需要占用大量 CPU 资源。\
     （作为参考 M2 Mac 需要约 3 分钟，16 核的 Epyc 需要几十秒）
   - 一定程度解决 bgm.tv 挂掉或被墙导致的报错

## What's Changed
* do not use series overview when the episode overview is empty by @huihuimoe in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/154
* fix: characters sort by relation by @chu-shen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/156
* feat: update Anitomy by @chu-shen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/157
* Feat sort by fuzzy by @chu-shen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/158
* fix: return all subjects after sorted by fuzzy by @chu-shen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/161

## New Contributors
* @huihuimoe made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/154

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.6.2...1.7.0

## Important
 - 增加了 API 地址修改功能，但还是建议给 Jellyfin 挂梯子
 - 现在修改设置后需要手动点击保存按钮

## What's Changed
* fix: fix movie play status syncing in JF movie libraries by @RandomNamer in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/136
* feat: traversal searching for next season by @RandomNamer in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/135
* fix error when season folder not exists by @fiochen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/141
* append available access token for emby

## New Contributors
* @RandomNamer made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/136

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.6.1...1.6.2

## What's Changed
* 修正登录授权地址错误

## What's Changed
* **升级至 Jellyfin 10.9.0**
* 增加季 ID 自动推算能力
* 新的搜索接口
* fix: empty exception message by @fiochen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/75
* feat: force episode for subject with single ep by @everpcpc in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/95
* Skip OVA in GuessNextSeason by @zeyugao in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/118
* 支持Emby自动点格子 by @zeyugao in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/108
* 切换到 Github Actions

> [!WARNING]
> 由于 Jellyfin API 变化，1.6.0 版本起不再支持 Jellyfin 10.8.13 及以下版本
> 另外 10.9.0 也无法使用旧版本插件，请使用这个版本
>
> Emby 版本需要升级至 4.9.0.12 以上

## New Contributors
* @zeyugao made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/118

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.5.18...1.6.0

## What's Changed
* feat: support parsing bangumi id from path attribute by @everpcpc in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/62
* 更换章节收藏信息API by @fiochen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/65
* fix: 重复标记已观看时，同步api检查状态 by @fiochen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/67
* feat: 设置节目到'在看/看过' by @fiochen in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/66

## New Contributors
* @everpcpc made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/62
* @fiochen made their first contribution in https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/pull/65

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/compare/1.5.0...1.5.18

- 增加 NSFW 内容标记
  - 在 bangumi 上标记为 NSFW 的番剧会被分级至 X
  - 可通过 jellyfin 自带家长控制功能限制
  - 默认禁用 NSFW 内容播放进度同步
    - 需要手动修改或刷新元数据使分级为 `JP-18+` `NC-17` 或更高
    - 各地区分级可见：https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin/tree/master/Emby.Server.Implementations/Localization/Ratings
- 增加对音乐和书籍的识别能力 #29 #38
- 增加接口超时时间设置
- 修正部分设置修改后需要重启才能生效的问题
- 优化特别篇（SP）识别能力
- 优化集号识别准确度
- 优化词条搜索逻辑 by @chu-shen #23
- 修正词条搜索时上映时间不正确的问题 by @RanKKI #31 
- 同步电视分类元数据识别逻辑至电影分类 by @wzyboy #46

- 支持通过 [Anitomy](https://github.com/erengy/anitomy) 解析番剧名称和级号 #15 by @chu-shen 
- 修正集数大于 100 时可能的死循环 #19

此版本主要为 bugfix
- 提升 SP / OP / ED 的识别能力
- 支持非整数集（比如某些番剧的 12.5 集）的识别
- 修正授权跳转地址不正确的问题

#10 #11 #13 #14

从此版本起可以支持将多季动漫收至单文件夹，可与 TheMovieDB 配合一起使用

新的目录结构：https://github.com/kookxiang/jellyfin-plugin-bangumi/wiki/%E5%8F%82%E8%80%83%E7%9B%AE%E5%BD%95%E7%BB%93%E6%9E%84

由于 bangumi 不支持查询动漫第 n 季的 id，使用时这种方式时需要手动填写季 id

其他更新内容

 - 升级到 .Net Core 6.0，对应 Jellyfin 10.8
 - 修复只能搜索到前 100 集的 bug #7
 - 修正 R18 动漫无法查看的 bug（需要账号授权） #9 
 - 优化搜索结果排序 #8 

注意：

1. 请下载 Fastenshtein.dll 一同放置在插件目录，否则搜索功能不可用
2. jellyfin 10.7 的用户请下载 `Jellyfin.Plugin.Bangumi.net50.dll` 插件，这会是最后一个支持 10.7 的版本，后续更新将不在支持老版本

支持 Jellyfin 10.8.0 Beta
升级到 .net core 6.0 （与新版 jellyfin 一致）

- 更新集号识别逻辑

同步测试版更新：

- 增加 OAuth 登录功能
- 同步播放进度至 bgm.tv

- 增加 OAuth 登录功能

# Self Service: 

* Users can link existing jellyfin accounts to SSO provider accounts
* Users can remove existing links
* Users can configure multiple SSO provider accounts
* Account names no longer have to match across Jellyfin -> SSO provider
  * Eg, can link google OIDC, with a `sub` of `asfbeausfahgajsfjasd-ugly-sub` to jellyfin username `matthew`

## What's Changed

### Features

* Implement Canonical Linking + Self Service by @matthewstrasiotto in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/34
   * Account names no longer have to match to be linked

### Fixes

* Fix ID Provider incorrectly resetting on login by @matthewstrasiotto in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/33

### Documentation

* Document Provider Specific Configuration, Small Readme Update by @matthewstrasiotto in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/31
* docs: move build-from-source to contributing section, link vscode config by @matthewstrasiotto in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/63
* docs: :memo: document new plugin install mechanism by @matthewstrasiotto in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/56

### CI / Build

* Add github action for publishing releases by @matthewstrasiotto in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/39
* Revert "Add github action for publishing releases" by @9p4 in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/40

* ci: add checksum to nightly builds by @matthewstrasiotto in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/53
* ci: only run checksum agaisnt zip files by @matthewstrasiotto in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/54
* build: ignore .vscode entirely in gitignore by @matthewstrasiotto in https://github.com/9p4/jellyfin-plugin-sso/pull/62

name: SmartLists
overview: Smart Playlists and Collections plugin for Jellyfin.
description:
Create dynamic playlists and collections in Jellyfin based on a set of rules, which will automatically update as your library changes.

https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin

versions.changelog:
<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.21.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* Added new 'Library Name' field
* You can now bulk convert playlists/collections
* Added support for automated backups in settings
### Other Changes
* Optimized rule field extraction logic - Major increase in performance
* Minor UX fixes


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.20.0...v10.11.21.0

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.20.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* Users can now create and manage their own smart lists (requires the plugins 'File Transformation' and 'Plugin Pages'). Read more in the documentation: https://jellyfin-smartlists-plugin.dinsten.se/getting-started/quick-start/
* Added support for sorting collections by aggregated child item values in collections/playlists
* Added support for uploading images
* Support nested collection searches with customizable search depth property
* Added support for production locations, custom rating, subtitle languages, and last episode air date.
### Bug Fixes
* Fixed an issue where the new user config page would not load properly in some cases.
* Fixed an issue with clone logic
* Fixed two issues when switching between collection/playlist, wrong user and unknown creation date
### Other Changes
* Prevent refresh of disabled lists
* Changed styling for compability with other Jellyfin themes
* Changed file storage structure
* Some minor styling and UI changes
* Added quick menu actions for lists in collapsed view


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.16.0...v10.11.20.0

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.16.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* You can now sort by and set limits to individual rule groups
* Added support for Actor Roles in people metadata.
### Bug Fixes
* Fixed a bug where negated operators did not work with playlist/collection rules
* Fixed some issues with rule group sorting


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.15.0...v10.11.16.0

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.15.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* Collection thumbnails are now generated automatically
* You can now schedule list visibility (enable/disable)


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.14.0...v10.11.15.0

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.14.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* Added support for Playlists in rule fields
### Bug Fixes
* Fix API doc generation error
### Other Changes
* Added plugin shortcut in the main sidebar.

## New Contributors
* @RedStylzZ made their first contribution in https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/pull/242

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.13.0...v10.11.14.0

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.13.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* You can now clone rule fields as well as clone and delete whole ruleblocks.
* You can now sort collections! (requires Jellyfin version 10.11.5)
### Bug Fixes
* Fixed an issue where the wrong user would be pre-selected when creating and cloning collections.
### Other Changes
* You can now close the notification popups


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.12.1...v10.11.13.0

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.12.1 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* The LastPlayedDate rule now works with Collections as well.
### Bug Fixes
* Fixed an issue where audio playlists couldn't be sorted by name (track title).
* Fixed an issue where playback status wasn't working properly in some cases.
### Other Changes
* Added documentation icons + other minor UI changes


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.12.0...v10.11.12.1

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.12.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* Refactored playback status rule field. You can now also choose 'In Progress' for media items.
### Bug Fixes
* Fixed an issue where collections containing series would not get automatically updated.
* Fixed an issue where Jellyfin playlists wouldn't get deleted when disabled or converted into Collections.
### Other Changes
* Poster images in collections with episodes are now fetched from the parent series.


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.11.0...v10.11.12.0

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.11.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* Added support for multiple playlist users.
* Added support for choosing only Audio Languages marked as default
### Bug Fixes
* Fixed issue where user names could show up twice in the list filters.
* Fixed an issue where lists wouldn't update automatically when a media item was marked as unwatched.
### Other Changes
* Added a multi-select dropdown for media types.


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.10.0...v10.11.11.0

## Major update with support for Collections!

- Name changed from SmartPlaylist to **SmartLists**
- Support for **Collections** has been added.
- The entire codebase has been **refactored**
- A **status page** has been added
- And **many** other backend changes

### Breaking changes

- Migration logic from older versions has been removed, you must be running **Jellyfin 10.11.2.0** and have **refreshed all playlists** prior to updating — skipping this may result in broken playlists.
- The legacy Jellyfin tasks have been removed. Make sure no playlists are using these, and if so, set a custom schedule for them instead.

If you encounter issues where the plugin is stuck in a restart loop because of the name change, uninstall the plugin, remove the SmartPlaylist folder (there might be two, remove both) from your Jellyfin plugin folder, reboot Jellyfin and then install the plugin again

If you find any bugs, please report them here: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/issues

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.2.0...v10.11.10.0

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.2.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* Added support for multiple sorting options. Added Episode and Season as sorting options.
* Add sorting options for Last Played, Runtime, Series Name, Album Name and Artist.
* The rule fields Studios and Genres can now search parent series for episodes.
### Bug Fixes
* Fixed a bug where the UI would incorrectly always show "Sunday" for weekly schedules.
### Other Changes
* Only show sort options related to the media type(s) selected.

## What's Changed
### New Features
* Refactored playback status rule field. You can now also choose 'In Progress' for media items.
### Bug Fixes
* Fixed an issue where collections containing series would not get automatically updated.
* Fixed an issue where Jellyfin playlists wouldn't get deleted when disabled or converted into Collections.
### Other Changes
* Poster images in collections with episodes are now fetched from the parent series.


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.11.0...v10.11.12.0

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at v10.11.11.0 -->

## What's Changed
### New Features
* Added support for multiple playlist users.
* Added support for choosing only Audio Languages marked as default
### Bug Fixes
* Fixed issue where user names could show up twice in the list filters.
* Fixed an issue where lists wouldn't update automatically when a media item was marked as unwatched.
### Other Changes
* Added a multi-select dropdown for media types.


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.10.0...v10.11.11.0

## Major update with support for Collections!

- Name changed from SmartPlaylist to **SmartLists**
- Support for **Collections** has been added.
- The entire codebase has been **refactored**
- A **status page** has been added
- And **many** other backend changes

### Breaking changes

- Migration logic from older versions has been removed, you must be running **Jellyfin 10.11.2.0** and have **refreshed all playlists** prior to updating — skipping this may result in broken playlists.
- The legacy Jellyfin tasks have been removed. Make sure no playlists are using these, and if so, set a custom schedule for them instead.

If you encounter issues where the plugin is stuck in a restart loop because of the name change, uninstall the plugin, remove the SmartPlaylist folder (there might be two, remove both) from your Jellyfin plugin folder, reboot Jellyfin and then install the plugin again

If you find any bugs, please report them here: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/issues

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/jyourstone/jellyfin-smartlists-plugin/compare/v10.11.2.0...v10.11.10.0

name: Jellynext
description:
A Jellyfin plugin that creates per-user virtual libraries for personalized Trakt recommendations and new seasons. Seamlessly integrates with Radarr and Sonarr to trigger one-click downloads directly from Jellyfin.

https://github.com/luall0/jellynext
overview: Trakt recommendations sync with Sonarr/Radarr support.

versions.changelog:
### Bug Fixes

- **Trending movies downloads**: Fixed download failure when playing trending movies
  - PlaybackInterceptor now correctly handles global content paths ()
  - Detects global content types and uses configured  for cache lookup
  - Previously failed because path parsing expected per-user GUID, not "global" keyword

### Improvements

- **Modular Configuration UI**: Refactored configuration page into maintainable tab-based architecture
  - Split 1843-line monolithic  into modular components (317-line main shell + 4 tab files)
  - Each tab isolated: , , ,  (~40-865 lines each)
  - New  serves tab resources from embedded resources via REST endpoints
  - Eager loading strategy ensures all tabs loaded before population
  - Proper async load order prevents race conditions (load tabs → config → users → populate UI)

### Bug Fixes

- **Configuration save errors**: Fixed JSON deserialization errors when saving with unconfigured Radarr/Sonarr
  - Changed  and  from  to  (nullable)
  - Added validation in  and  before using profile IDs
  - Fixed JavaScript to properly handle empty select values (avoid  → )
- **Race condition in trending settings**: Fixed issue where user selection was lost on page reload
  -  now returns promise to ensure dropdown is populated before setting selected value
  - Prevents accidental overwrite of  with null

### Technical

- Updated CLAUDE.md with configuration page architecture patterns and load order requirements

### Features

- **Download Integration Modes**: Complete overhaul of download system with three pluggable integration modes
  - **Native Mode** (default): Direct Radarr/Sonarr API integration for granular control
  - **Jellyseerr Mode**: Centralized request management with approval workflows and multi-user tracking
  - **Webhook Mode**: Custom HTTP webhooks for complete flexibility and external system integration
  - Factory pattern () selects provider based on configuration
  - All modes support anime detection and per-season TV downloads

- **Jellyseerr Integration**: Full integration with Jellyseerr request management system
  - **Automatic user import**: Jellyfin users auto-imported to Jellyseerr on first request with REQUEST-only permissions
  - **Per-user attribution**: All requests tracked per-user via  header
  - **Approval workflows**: Respects Jellyseerr approval settings and request quotas
  - **Configuration modes**:
    - Default mode: Uses Jellyseerr's default Radarr/Sonarr server and profile settings
    - Manual mode: Explicit server and profile selection from UI dropdowns
  - **Server/profile selection**: UI dynamically loads Radarr/Sonarr servers and quality profiles from Jellyseerr
  - **Anime support**: Optional separate anime profile for TV shows detected via Trakt genres
  - **GUID normalization**: Handles UUID format differences between Jellyseerr (no hyphens) and Jellyfin (standard format)
  - **Connection testing**: Test Jellyseerr connection and validate API key from plugin settings
  - New service:  for API communication
  - New controller:  for UI configuration
  - New models: , , , , 

- **Webhook Integration**: Custom HTTP webhook support for external integrations
  - **Flexible HTTP methods**: GET, POST, PUT, PATCH support
  - **Dynamic placeholders**: Replace variables in URLs, headers, and payloads
    - Movies: , , , , 
    - TV Shows: All movie placeholders + , , 
  - **Custom headers**: Add authentication, API keys, or any custom headers with placeholder support
  - **JSON payload templates**: Fully customizable request body with default templates included
  - **Separate configurations**: Independent settings for movies vs TV shows
  - **Use cases**: Discord/Slack notifications, custom download systems, third-party automation
  - New service:  implementing 
  - New configuration fields: , , , , , , 
  - New model:  for custom header configuration
  - Comprehensive documentation: New  guide with examples and troubleshooting

### Improvements

- **Download Provider Architecture**: Pluggable provider system for extensibility
  -  interface defines contract for all download providers
  - : Implements direct Radarr/Sonarr integration
  - : Implements Jellyseerr API integration
  - : Implements custom HTTP webhook integration
  - : Factory pattern selects provider based on  enum
  -  uses factory to route download requests

- **Configuration UI Enhancements**: Redesigned download integration section
  - **Visual integration selector**: Card-based UI with icons and descriptions for each mode
  - **Dynamic sections**: UI shows/hides relevant settings based on selected integration mode
  - **Webhook UI**: Interactive payload editors with placeholder insertion buttons
  - **Header management**: Add/remove custom headers dynamically for webhook requests
  - **Payload reset**: Quick reset to default payload templates
  - **Real-time validation**: Client-side validation for URLs, headers, and JSON payloads

- **Documentation**: Comprehensive guides for all integration modes
  - Updated README.md with three integration modes in setup guide
  - New WEBHOOK.md with complete webhook integration guide including:
    - Configuration examples (GET, POST, authentication, Discord/Slack)
    - Building custom webhook endpoints (Python Flask, Node.js Express)
    - Troubleshooting guide
    - Security considerations
    - Advanced usage patterns
  - Updated CLAUDE.md with download provider architecture
  - FAQ updates covering all three integration modes

### Technical Changes

- **New enum**:  with values: , , 
- **Configuration migration**: Changed from  boolean to  enum (backward compatible)
- **Service registration**: All download providers registered in 
- **API Controllers**:
  - : Connection testing, server/profile retrieval
  - Enhanced error handling and logging across all providers
- **Models**:
  - : Jellyseerr request model with media IDs and user tracking
  - : User model for auto-import functionality
  -  / : Server configuration models
  - : Custom header model for webhook requests
- **HTTP Client**: All providers use  for Cloudflare bypass compatibility

### Improvements

- **Configuration UI Redesign**: Complete overhaul of plugin settings interface with native Jellyfin tab styling
  - **Tab-based layout**: Organized settings into 4 tabs (General, Trakt, Trending, Downloads)
  - **Native Jellyfin styling**: Uses  and  classes matching Jellyfin's UI patterns
  - **Unified save button**: Single save button now handles all settings including per-user Trakt configurations
  - **Improved UX**: Removed redundant "Save User Settings" button, cleaner tab navigation

- **Virtual Library Management**: Enhanced global content directory handling
  - **Automatic cleanup**: Trending movies directory now automatically flushed when feature is disabled
  - **Consistent state**: Prevents stale content from appearing in global libraries after configuration changes

### Improvements

- **Shows Cache Refactoring**: Complete overhaul of season-level caching system
  - **Hybrid architecture**: Global show/season metadata cache + per-user watch progress tracking
  - **Incremental sync**: History-based delta syncing via  endpoint reduces API load
  - **Smart caching**: Ended shows cache all seasons immediately, ongoing shows only cache complete seasons
  - **Automatic sync mode**:  automatically detects first run and falls back to full sync
  - **In-memory timestamps**: Last sync timestamp no longer persisted to config (triggers full sync on restart for data freshness)
  - **Zero duplicate API calls**: Both RecommendationsProvider and NextSeasonsProvider read from same cache
  - **Progressive discovery**: As users watch episodes, incremental sync detects progression and triggers next season recommendations

- **Next Seasons Provider Enhancement**: Improved reliability and efficiency
  - **Sync-first approach**: Calls  before fetching content
  - **Cache-only reads**: Retrieves watched progress + season metadata entirely from cache (no duplicate Trakt API calls)
  - **Dynamic fetching**: If next season not in cache for ongoing shows, fetches latest from Trakt API and checks season count
  - **Better library deduplication**: Uses LocalLibraryService to exclude shows already in Jellyfin library

- **Recommendations Provider Optimization**: Uses ShowsCacheService for season counts to avoid duplicate API calls

- **Configuration Simplification**: Removed  setting (no longer needed with new cache architecture)

### Technical Changes

- **New models**:
  - : Global show/season metadata (Title, Year, IDs, Status, Genres, Seasons dictionary)
  - : Season-level data (SeasonNumber, EpisodeCount, AiredEpisodes, FirstAired, IsComplete property)
  - : For parsing  endpoint
  - : Episode metadata for history items

- **Deleted files**:
  -  (replaced by )
  -  (replaced by  + )

- **API additions**:
  - : Fetches watch history with automatic pagination support (100 items/page)
  - : Enhanced with  parameter for genre data

- **Service registration**: Updated  to use  instead of

### Bug Fixes

- **Jellyfin 10.11.0 Compatibility**: Pin SDK to exact version 10.11.0 to ensure compatibility across all 10.11.x releases
  - Changed  and  dependencies from  to 
  - Fixes  on Jellyfin servers running 10.11.0 and 10.11.1
  - Plugin now works on Jellyfin 10.11.0+

### Documentation

- **Enhanced Setup Instructions**: Added detailed virtual library path discovery instructions
  - Included example log output showing exact paths for each content type
  - Clarified Docker path usage ()
  - Added step-by-step guide for finding jellynext-virtual directory via Jellyfin logs after Trakt user configuration
  - Improved user experience for first-time setup

### Bug Fixes

- **Configuration Save Error**: Fix  when saving configuration with trending movies disabled
  -  is now only included in configuration POST when trending is enabled and a valid user is selected
  - Prevents empty string from being parsed as GUID when trending movies is not configured

### Features

- **Trending Movies (Global)**: Added global trending movies feature visible to all users
  - New global content type: 
  - Non-personalized trending movies from Trakt
  - Configurable via Dashboard → Plugins → JellyNext → Trending Movies (Global)
  - Settings:
    - Enable/disable toggle
    - Source user selection (which Trakt account to use for API access)
    - Limit: 1-100 movies (default: 50)
  - Virtual library path: 
  - Directory automatically created on plugin startup when enabled
  - Supports same one-click Radarr download functionality as per-user recommendations

### Improvements

- **Global Content Architecture**: Extended virtual library system to support both per-user and global content types
  - New helper method:  to distinguish content types
  -  now handles both per-user () and global () paths
  - Automatic directory initialization for global content types
  - Setup instructions now include global libraries when enabled
- **Trakt API**: Added  method to fetch trending movies with configurable limits
- **New Provider**:  implements  for modular trending movies support
- **Documentation**: Updated CLAUDE.md and README.md with global content architecture and trending movies feature

### Features

- **Per-User Recommendation Limits**: Added configurable limits for movie and show recommendations (1-100, default: 50)
  - New settings:  and  in per-user configuration
  - Configurable via Dashboard → Plugins → JellyNext → User Settings
  - Validated on both client and server with  to enforce 1-100 range
  - Each user can control how many recommendations they want to fetch

### Features

- **Short Dummy Video Option**: Added configurable 2-second dummy video for automatic playback stop on all clients
  - New setting:  (default: enabled)
  - When enabled: Uses 2-second video that auto-stops playback even on clients without API support
  - When disabled: Uses 1-hour video (prevents "watched" status but requires manual stop)
  - Configurable via Dashboard → Plugins → JellyNext → Playback Settings
  - New embedded resource:  (~5KB vs ~2MB for long version)

### Improvements

- **Automatic Stub Refresh on Config Change**: Virtual library stub files now automatically rebuild when dummy video setting is changed
  - Validates stub file content matches current configuration on each sync
  - Flushes and rebuilds directory if mismatch detected
  - Ensures consistent experience across all virtual items
- **Better Client Compatibility**: Short dummy video provides automatic stop on clients that don't support Jellyfin's playback control API

### Features

- **Configurable Playback Stop Delay**: Added setting to configure delay before stopping playback of virtual items (default: 2 seconds, range: 0-30)
  - Allows users to adjust timing for clients that need more initialization time
  - Configurable via Dashboard → Plugins → JellyNext → Playback Settings

### Improvements

- **Reduced Default Playback Delay**: Changed default playback stop delay from 5 seconds to 2 seconds for faster user experience
- **Enhanced Documentation**: Added comprehensive "Playback Stop Behavior" section to README explaining:
  - How automatic playback stop works
  - Client compatibility information
  - Instructions for clients that don't support automatic stop
  - Clarification that download triggers immediately regardless of stop behavior

### Bug Fixes

- **Sonarr Integration**: Fix series monitoring update failure caused by missing  field in API requests

### Features

- **Per-User Trakt Integration**: OAuth 2.0 device flow authentication with automatic token refresh
- **Virtual Libraries**: Three dedicated libraries per user (Movie Recommendations, Show Recommendations, Next Seasons)
- **One-Click Downloads**: Automatic Radarr/Sonarr integration triggered by playback attempts
- **Per-Season TV Downloads**: Granular control to download specific seasons only
- **Anime Detection**: Automatic routing to separate Sonarr anime folder based on Trakt genres
- **Smart Caching**: Configurable content cache (6hr default) and ended shows cache (7 day default)
- **Per-User Settings**: Granular sync control (movies, shows, next seasons), content filtering (collected, watchlisted), performance options (season 1 limit)
- **Automatic Sync**: Background sync task (6hr interval) with startup sync (5s after start)
- **iOS/tvOS Compatibility**: FFprobe-compatible dummy video files prevent client crashes
- **Native Jellyfin Integration**: Standard .strm file naming with TMDB/TVDB metadata providers
- **Configuration UI**: Web-based admin interface for Trakt/Radarr/Sonarr setup and user management

name: Authelia Authentication
description:
Authenticate your Jellyfin with Authelia, and optionally create users who do not yet exist automatically.

This plugin uses Authelia HTTP API for authentication. Unlike with an SSO plugin, this allows using the existing Jellyfin login UI and API, which is compatible with all existing Jellyfin clients.
The main drawback of this approach is that 2FA is not supported.


https://github.com/nikarh/jellyfin-plugin-authelia
overview: Authenticate users via Authelia

name: Local Recommendations
overview: Privacy-first personalized recommendations based on local watch history
description:
Generate per-user content recommendations using TF-IDF embeddings and cosine similarity. All processing happens locally with zero tracking or cloud dependencies. Recommendations appear as virtual libraries accessible from all Jellyfin clients.

https://github.com/rdpharr/jellyfin-plugin-localrecs

versions.changelog:
Image sync for custom posters and backdrops
- Custom poster images are now preserved in recommendation libraries
- Copies poster.jpg and backdrop.jpg from source items to virtual folders
- Configurable: Enable/disable image sync and backdrop copying
- Fixes issue where user customizations (e.g., French posters) were lost

Decade-based temporal similarity and bug fix
- Recommendations now consider content from similar time periods
- Decade grouping (1980s, 1990s, etc.) replaces continuous year normalization
- Improves temporal relevance alongside genre/actor/director similarity
- Tested with production data: ~12 decades extracted from 970 items
- Observable impact: 24% of movie recommendations changed, 8% of TV
- Fixed: In-progress TV series no longer appear in recommendations

Series filtering fix and play status sync
- Fixed fully watched series appearing in recommendations
- Play status sync from source library when virtual items are scanned
- Rating proximity scoring feature
- Removed NFO file generation (Jellyfin doesn't read NFO for .strm files)
- Reduced debug logging noise

Fix NFO metadata parsing
- Fixed XML encoding (UTF-16 to UTF-8) so Jellyfin reads runtime correctly
- Added cast, directors, and writers to NFO files
- Added fileinfo/streamdetails for video/audio/subtitle stream selectors

NFO metadata and trailer support
- NFO files with full metadata (runtime, ratings, genres, studios, tags)
- Local trailer support via -trailer.strm files
- Movie folder structure for better metadata handling
- Fixed copy buttons on setup page
- Improved documentation

Initial beta release
- Per-user personalized recommendations for movies and TV shows
- Content-based filtering using TF-IDF embeddings
- Virtual library integration for universal client compatibility
- Configurable weighting (favorites, rewatches, recency)
- Abandoned series exclusion
- Daily scheduled updates with manual refresh option
- Complete privacy - all processing local

name: Shoko
description:
A Jellyfin plugin to integrate [Jellyfin](https://jellyfin.org/docs/) with [Shoko Server](https://shokoanime.com/downloads/shoko-server/).
## Read this before installing
**This plugin requires that you have already set up and are using Shoko Server**, and that the files you intend to include in Jellyfin are **indexed** (and optionally managed) by Shoko Server. **Otherwise, the plugin won't be able to provide metadata for your files**, since there is no metadata to find for them.


https://github.com/ShokoAnime/Shokofin
overview: Manage your anime from Jellyfin using metadata from Shoko

name: Spotify Import
description:
This plugin enables you to import playlists from Spotify to your Jellyfin server automatically. It provides a scheduled task that queries a given list of Spotify playlists and tries to recreate them as best as possible in Jellyfin.


https://github.com/Viperinius/jellyfin-plugin-spotify-import
overview: This plugin imports playlists from Spotify.

versions.changelog:
# Changelog

## [1.16.0.0] - 2025-10-21

### Added

- Support for Jellyfin 10.11

# Changelog

## [1.15.1.0] - 2025-10-21

### Changed

- Replace the default URL for Spotify TOTP

# Changelog

## [1.15.0.0] - 2025-10-01

### Added

- Also ignore diacritics when using match level Ignore Punctuation + Case (or further relaxed levels)

### Changed

- Manual map interface now allows pasting in JSON (e.g. missing tracks file entries)
- Manual map entries can now be specified either be the previous information or just using the Spotify track ID / URI, similar to how playlist URIs are handled when configuring the plugin

# Changelog

## [1.14.1.0] - 2025-09-13

### Fixed

- Excessive memory use when updating the ISRC / MusicBrainz cache in some situations

# Changelog

## [1.14.0.0] - 2025-09-12

### Added

- New matching method via MusicBrainz and ISRC IDs
- The plugin settings page now contains a checkbox to activate the new MusicBrainz matching method
- Support for the import of the "Liked Songs" section from Spotify

### Changed

- The current scopes of the Spotify auth token are now displayed on the plugin settings page

# Changelog

## [1.13.1.0] - 2025-08-14

### Fixed

- Fix missing progress reporting of import task
- Fix wrong parameters for some logging entries (see issue #63)
- Fix procedure to aquire auth token for alternative Spotify provider after recent changes made by Spotify (again)

# Changelog

## [1.13.0.0] - 2025-03-24

### Added

- Caching of Spotify playlists (only query the full track data if the playlist state changed)
- Caching of track matches (reuse match of a track for all occurrences across playlists)

### Fixed

- Fix procedure to aquire auth token for alternative Spotify provider after recent changes made by Spotify (again)

# Changelog

## [1.12.4.0] - 2025-03-11

### Fixed

- Fix procedure to aquire auth token for alternative Spotify provider after recent changes made by Spotify

# Changelog

## [1.12.3.0] - 2025-01-25

### Fixed

- Fix manual track map path not being found depending on the plugin location
- Fix exception handling if the manual track map does not exist yet

# Changelog

## [1.12.2.0] - 2025-01-07

### Fixed

- Fix parsing of empty artist fields when adding manual map entries

# Changelog

## [1.12.1.0] - 2024-12-08

### Fixed

- Fix missing handling of request timeouts when using the alternative Spotify provider

# Changelog

## [1.12.0.0] - 2024-12-07

### Added

- Workaround regarding the recent Spotify API changes (#48)

# Changelog

## [1.11.0.0] - 2024-11-30

### Added

- Support for manually mapping tracks between Spotify and Jellyfin (#44)

### Fixed

- Keep iterating through artists even after a first match was found (in case multiple artists with the same name exist)
- Fix exception getting user playlists due to changes in the Spotify API (#46)

# Changelog

## [1.10.0.0] - 2024-09-14

### Added

- New option to set playlists as private or public to all users

### Fixed

- Exception if Spotify returns duplicate playlists for a user

# Changelog

## [1.9.0.0] - 2024-08-25

### Added

- New setting to enable imported "progress" to be displayed in the playlist description -> #30
- New matching type to extract an album name from the track name (like 'Track [From "An Album"]') and use that for comparison

### Changed

- Updated Jellyfin dependencies to match version 10.9.9
- Switch request handling on plugin config page to use jellyfin custom fetch mechanism

# Changelog

## [1.8.1.1] - 2024-06-21

### Fixed

- Include missing Fastenshtein dependency in build artifacts

# Changelog

## [1.8.1.0] - 2024-05-19

### Fixed

- Broken API endpoints (due to authorisation policy changes in Jellyfin introduced in 10.9)

# Changelog

## [1.8.0.0] - 2024-05-17

### Added

- Support for Jellyfin 10.9
- New configurable flag for each playlist whether or not to recreate it from scratch each time the task runs
- New matching type "fuzzy checking" for track and album names

### Changed

- "Ignore Parentheses" now treats [] the same as ()
- Some rework of the track matching process (again); the plugin now tries to find all potential matches first and then decides a "best fit" track name

# Changelog

## [1.7.2.0] - 2024-03-29

### Fixed

- Accept matches where Spotify uses a different track syntax than metadata providers (e.g. "Track Name - Super Remix" on Spotify and "Track Name (Super Remix)" on MusicBrainz) if at least match level `Ignore Case + Punctuation` is used

# Changelog

## [1.7.1.0] - 2024-03-18

### Changed

- Reintroduce the old track matching method as a configurable legacy alternative (not recommended to be used)
- Extend logging information / debug possibilities

# Changelog

## [1.7.0.0] - 2024-03-10

### Changed

- If a track / album / artist contains text in parentheses, this content will be used as another match candidate (e.g. to match tracks that have an english translation of a foreign name)

### Fixed

- Fix broken track matching if multiple artists of a track exist in Jellyfin, but the track is not located under the first existing artist
- Fix not matching tracks if their album is not a direct child of their artist and (for whatever reason) only detectable via the album artist

# Changelog

## [1.6.0.0] - 2024-02-23

### Changed

- Search Jellyfin server for artist instead of individual tracks and narrow track matching down from there
- Search Jellyfin server using only the first few characters of an artist name to increase chances of finding matches with slightly different names
- Use all (album) artists from Spotify to check whether a matching artist exists in Jellyfin, not just the first one

### Fixed

- Catch exceptions from Spotify API lib when retrieving users / playlists

# Changelog

## [1.5.0.0] - 2023-12-16

### Added

- New switch to control where missing track files are stored
- Add new matcher to ignore anything in parentheses in track/album/artist names

### Fixed

- Fix Spotify username regex not allowing special characters

# Changelog

## [1.4.0.0] - 2023-10-15

### Added

- Auto-migration of plugin configurations from previous plugin versions
- More verbose logging that can be enabled

### Changed

- Reworked handling of Spotify user IDs to get all their playlists (moved to its own table separate from individual playlist IDs)

### Fixed

- Fix bug in config page that reset all unsaved table row states when adding a new row
- Fix parsing of Spotify URLs that contain parameters

# Changelog

## [1.3.0.0] - 2023-08-13

### Added

- Extend playlist configuration by allowing user IDs as input, which leads to all of their playlists getting imported automatically

### Fixed

- Fix exception if a Spotify track contains no album artists metadata

# Changelog

## [1.2.0.0] - 2023-07-01

### Added

- Extend playlist configurability
  - Allow own playlist names
  - Set target owner / user
- Allow configuration of the track matcher
  - Choose comparison strictness
  - Choose what parts of the metadata get examined / compared

# Changelog

## [1.1.1.0] - 2023-05-06

### Fixed

- Fix exception if a Spotify playlist contains "ghost" items / null tracks
- A missing tracks file is created even though the playlist is not missing any tracks
- Fix config page not loading values when revisiting without a full page reload

# Changelog

## [1.1.0.0] - 2023-04-15

### Added

- New button to delete all generated missing tracks files
- New option to specify the date format used for missing tracks file names

### Fixed

- A missing tracks file is created even though the playlist is not missing any tracks
- Fix exception if a song has no artists, album name or album artists set

# Changelog

## [1.0.0.0] - 2023-02-26

- Initial release

### Added

- Spotify authentication via authorization code / PKCE
- Generation of missing tracks lists
- Import of Spotify playlists

name: LDAP Authentication
description:
Authenticate your Jellyfin users against an LDAP database, and optionally create users who do not yet exist automatically.

Allows the administrator to customize most aspects of the LDAP authentication process, including customizable search attributes, username attribute, and a search filter for administrative users (set on user creation). The user, via the "Manual Login" process, can enter any valid attribute value, which will be mapped back to the specified username attribute automatically as well.
overview: Authenticate users against an LDAP database

versions.changelog:
🪲 Bug Fixes

- Further fixes to performance issues, this time more wholesale across all the supported sections. I found a different way to get items from the library which seems to be significantly quicker than the old approach.

🌐 Translations

- Added Russian translations (PR #191, @gallyamb)
- Added Mexican Spanish translations (PR #194, @josephmora)

🪲 Bug Fixes

- Fixed issue where LatestShows/LatestMovies was really really slow. I've personally seen a 15x speed improvement when collecting items from this section

✨ New Features

- Added support for 10.11.6

🪲 Bug Fixes

- Fixed #177 - Added support for hiding watched episodes in the combined Continue Watching / Next Up section (PR #178, @AdamWHY2K)

🌐 Translations

- Added Turkish translations (PR #186, @dgkndemir)
- Added Czech translations (PR #187, @vdobes)

🪲 Bug Fixes

- Fixed #176 and https://github.com/IAmParadox27/jellyfin-plugin-file-transformation/issues/33, Solves issue where dll scan could happen on missing directory causing the plugin to malfunction

🪲 Bug Fixes

- Fixed #173; Order index 0 was previously being mishandled in the new section logic, this has now been rectified so previous configurations should continue to work.
- Fixed LiveTV localization key being inconsistent with section key

✨ New Features

- Added "Continue Watching / Next Up" combined section. Closes: https://features.iamparadox.dev/posts/46/add-the-option-to-combine-next-up-and-continue-watching
- Added offline translation support as a preferred alternative to LibreTranslate. Translations are community driven and pulled daily into the plugin if there is an internet connection, otherwise it will only use the embedded translations. Initially supported languages are; English, French, Italian, German, Spanish, Portuguese, Brazilian Portuguese, Swedish, Dutch. Please note these translations have been done using AI and if there are any issues please open a PR to rectify them.
- Added lazy loading support for the home screen, this new feature means that home screens should load quicker and will dynamically load new sections as the user scrolls to the bottom of the page. As time goes on this feature papers the way for a truly infinite home screen. Future releases will include more configuration properties, for now the only configurables are whether to enable lazy loading and how many sections per page there are.

🪲 Bug Fixes

- Fixed #130; Images are now dynamically resized if too large to avoid very high quality posters that aren't necessary (PR #139, @AdamWHY2K)
- Fixed #159; LG WebOS clients wouldn't be functional at all due to DOM incompatibilities that have now been fixed (PR #170, @WoolMagician)

🌐 Translations

- Added Hungarian translation (PR #172, @Gabor2180)

🔜 Coming Soon

- "Starring" and "Directed By" sections will soon be added to HSS! I've been working hard on trying to get these sections ready for this release but unfortunately the performance of them isn't at the level I'd like for release so these have been disabled for the time being.

🎉 Thank you!

- I'd just like to also say a massive thank you to everyone who's started using Home Screen Sections this year, as well as those contributing to its improvements, its been amazing to see in the 10 months since my initial release the amount of use and love my plugins get and I just wanted to say a huge thank you! For those who celebrate it I hope you have a great Christmas, for those that don't I hope 2025 has been a wonderful year for you. I wish you all a very happy new year, and an amazing 2026! Thank you again!

✨ New Features

- Updated to support 10.11.5

⚡ Performance Improvements

- Optimized Latest Shows, Genre and Watch Again sections to avoid using N+1 complexity algorithms (PR #163, @gageorsburn)

🪲 Bug Fixes

- Fixed issue with usernames not being passed as url encoded to Jellyseerr (PR #160, @WoolMagician)
- Sort "My Requests" section without media type grouping (PR #162, @ZorudaRinku)
- Fixed #142; Allow the user to choose with Radarr release types to consider in "Upcoming" (PR #164, @AdamWHY2K)

✨ New Features

- Updated to support 10.11.4
- PR#155 - Added support for internal/external jellyseerr urls. Thanks @botagas
